instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used to classify and identify the four origins of Curcuma?

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used to classify and identify the four origins of Curcuma?
Output: The spectral feature processing methods used in this study were the support vector machine method (specifically the Ramp Loss K-SVC method), principal component analysis method, random forest (RF), and extreme learning machine algorithm (ELM).

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the identification rate of the four origins of Curcuma?
Output: The metric used to classify and identify the four origins of Curcuma was classification accuracy.

instruction: How did the researchers optimize the model parameters in order to distinguish Curcuma with four different origins using terahertz time-domain spectroscopy combined with chemometric methods?

instruction: Can terahertz time-domain spectroscopy combined with chemometric methods be considered a superior identification technique for the four easily confused origins of Curcuma, based on the increased identification rate achieved?
